TestStep.Description: (Android only) Runs a shell script that invokes Bonnie++ and keeps it running for the specified duration. I don't know of any version of Bonnie++ for Windows or other OSes, so this is intended only for Android at this time. Prerequisites: the following scripts and binaries must be located in the path specified by SCRIPTS_PATH: bonnie++ killer.sh process loopBonnie++.sh These files can be found in this tarball in Artifactory: acs_test_artifacts/CONCURRENCY/TESTS/bonnie_plus_plus/bonnie_plus_plus.tgz.

Parameter.name: DEVICE
Parameter.Description: Device that will run the application

Parameter.name: DURATION
Parameter.Description: How long the test will run, in minutes.

Parameter.name: SCRIPTS_PATH
Parameter.Description: Directory on the DUT where the scripts and binary are located.

Parameter.name: TARGET_DEVICES
Parameter.Description: List of devices for Bonnie++ to target, separated by '[|]'. Example: "'/dev/block/mmcblk0p9'[|]'/dev/block/mmcblk1p1'". Be careful to individually quote each list element if it contains characters that might be misinterpreted when evaluating the data type.

Parameter.name: SIZE
Parameter.Description: Size of data to transfer (MiB)

TestStep.Description: For Version2.7 :Runs a shell script that invokes GLBenchmark and keeps it running for the specified duration. For Version 3.0 : Opens the application and runs the test without using the shell script. PREREQUISITES: Android: the following script must be located in the path specified by SCRIPTS_PATH: run_glbenchmark_27.sh This can be found in Artifactory at acs_test_artifacts/CONCURRENCY/TESTS/GLBenchmark. In addition, the following APK should be installed on the DUT: GLBenchmark_2_7_0_Release_a68901_Android_Corporate_Package.apk This can be found in Artifactory at acs_test_artifacts/BENCHMARKS/GLBENCHMARK. Windows: binary and device-side scripts not yet created.

Parameter.name: DEVICE
Parameter.Description: Device that will run the application

Parameter.name: DURATION
Parameter.Description: How long the test will run, in minutes.

Parameter.name: SCRIPTS_PATH
Parameter.Description: Directory on the DUT where the script is located.

Parameter.name: VERSION
Parameter.Description: The version of the benchmark 3.0 or 2.7

TestStep.Description: Runs a shell script that invokes Basemark and keeps it running for the specified duration. PREREQUISITES: Android: the contents of this tarball must be unpacked into the directory specified in SCRIPTS_PATH. basemarkes2v1_files.tgz This can be found in Artifactory at acs_test_artifacts/CONCURRENCY/TESTS/basemark. Windows: binary and device-side scripts not yet created.

Parameter.name: DEVICE
Parameter.Description: Device that will run the application

Parameter.name: DURATION
Parameter.Description: How long the test will run, in minutes.

Parameter.name: SCRIPTS_PATH
Parameter.Description: Directory on the DUT where the tarball was unpacked.

TestStep.Description: It runs the 3Dmark test for a specified duration. PREREQUISITES: 3D mark application needs to be installed on the device before running test. The application can be found at CONCURRENCY/TESTS/3d_mark/com.futuremark.dmandroid.application-1.apk

Parameter.name: DEVICE
Parameter.Description: Device that will run the application

Parameter.name: DURATION
Parameter.Description: How long the test will run, in minutes.

TestStep.Description: Runs a shell script that invokes a CPU benchmark called Linpack. The Linpack benchmark is a measure of a computerâ€™s floating-point rate of execution. This benchmark computes the solution of a system of N linear equations with N unknowns. There are several versions of the Linpack benchmark, differing in size, numerical precision, and rules. This version is an Intel-customized version. The original Linpack was intended for systems with a distributed memory. PREREQUISITES: Android: scripts and binaries from linpack_files.tgz must be located in the path specified by SCRIPTS_PATH. This tarball can be found in Artifactory at acs_test_artifacts/CONCURRENCY/TESTS/linpack/linpack_files.tgz. Windows: binary and device-side scripts not yet created.

Parameter.name: DEVICE
Parameter.Description: Device that will run the application

Parameter.name: DURATION
Parameter.Description: How long the test will run, in minutes.

Parameter.name: SCRIPTS_PATH
Parameter.Description: Directory on the device where the required scripts and binaries have been installed.

TestStep.Description: Runs a command, checks if the output is the expected one and sends the verdict (PASSED/FAILED) to TCR as a testcase iteration if required. It should be used only in a "check config" testcase which purpose is to check if the device configuration is correct (for example : getprop, cat sysfs values...).

Parameter.name: DEVICE
Parameter.Description: Device that will run the application

Parameter.name: CHECK_NAME
Parameter.Description: Name of the check

Parameter.name: CMD
Parameter.Description: Command to execute

Parameter.name: EXPECTED_OUTPUT
Parameter.Description: Command output expected

Parameter.name: PUSH_ITERATION
Parameter.Description: To push or not an iteration to TCR

TestStep.Description: Runs a pnp performance based on pnp java fwk test PREREQUISITES: Android: benchmark app must be installed on the device pnp fwk jar files must be pushed on the device

Parameter.name: DEVICE
Parameter.Description: Device that will run the application

Parameter.name: TEST_NAME
Parameter.Description: Test class to execute

Parameter.name: TIMEOUT
Parameter.Description: How long the test will run, in minutes.

Parameter.name: EXTRA_OPTS
Parameter.Description: Extra options for uiautomator

TestStep.Description: Runs a pnp performance based on pnp java fwk test PREREQUISITES: Android: benchmark app must be installed on the device pnp fwk jar files must be pushed on the device

Parameter.name: DEVICE
Parameter.Description: Device that will run the application

Parameter.name: SCENARIO
Parameter.Description: Test class to execute

Parameter.name: TEST_TYPE
Parameter.Description: Type of the test, can be ux or benchmarks

Parameter.name: PARAMETERS
Parameter.Description: Parameters to add to the scenario
